CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 13, 1954, pg. 21, reads: "FILMS - Movie exhibitors, their sales and office force heard Jackie's plea for the local counterpoint of the interracial understanding he found while making the picture of his life story in Hollywood. With him and Radelat are Al Levy, left, Twentieth Century Fox; John Maloney, MGM, and Bert Stearn, Cooperative Theatres." Introduction reads: "Jackie Robinson, 1954 chairman of the Commission on Community Organizations of the National Conference of Christians and Jews, is undertaking a nation-wide tour building interest in Brotherhood Week, to be celebrated Feb. 21 - 28.  He was in Pittsburgh Monday.  Other stops include Detroit, South Bend, St. Louis, Tulsa and Los Angeles.  Louis A. Radelat, director of the commission, accompanied Jackie."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Al Levy, Louis A. Radelat, Jackie Robinson shaking hands with John Maloney, and Bert Stern, standing in front of curtain
